table.name: Menu
table.description: A collection of view/column based functionalities. It can be displayed in various forms like dropdown/toolbar.

column.name: MENUID_NO
column.description: Auto generated unique ID to identify the menu.

column.name: MENUID
column.description: Unique name to identify a menu.

column.name: ROLENAME
column.description: Authorization role assigned to the menu

column.name: DISPLAYNAME
column.description: Name displayed in the UI.

column.name: HANDLER
column.description: Fully qualified name of the handler class which manages the menu item functionalities. It must be a child of {@link com.adventnet.client.action.web.MenuHandler} class

column.name: DESCRIPTION
column.description: About the menu.

column.name: DISPLAYTYPE
column.description: Type of the menu to be displayed

column.name: DISPLAYSTYLE
column.description: Orientation of the menu in the UI. Default: NORMAL

column.name: MENUTEMPLATE
column.description: Template name, if 'DISPLAYSTYLE' is 'TEMPLATEDROPDOWN'

table.name: MenuItem
table.description: Contains details about how a menu-item is displayed in UI.

column.name: MENUITEMID_NO
column.description: Auto generated unique ID of the menu-item.

column.name: MENUITEMID
column.description: Unique name of the menu-item

column.name: ROLENAME
column.description: Authorization role assigned to the menu-item

column.name: DISPLAYNAME
column.description: Name displayed in the UI

column.name: DESCRIPTION
column.description: About the menu-item

column.name: IMAGE
column.description: Relative path of the image to be shown as/in menu-item

column.name: CONFIRMSTRING
column.description: Customizable message to be shown, to confirm the chosen action.

column.name: IMAGECSSCLASS
column.description: CSS class inplace of image

column.name: ATLEASTSELECTONESTRING
column.description: Customizable message to be shown, when no rows are selected while invoking the menu-item

column.name: TITLE
column.description: Customizable message to be shown for the onmouseover event of the menu item

column.name: LINKOPTION
column.description: By default the menu-item invocation will call a javascript function. If given as 'LINK' then menu-item action is triggered using the link.

column.name: CSSCLASS
column.description: CSS class for the menu-item

column.name: TITLEFORDISABLE
column.description: Customizable message to be shown for the onmouseover event of the disabled menu item

column.name: IMAGECSSCLASSFORDISABLE
column.description: CSS class inplace of image which is used for disabled menu-item.

column.name: IMAGEFORDISABLE
column.description: Image to be shown along with the disabled menu item.

column.name: CSSCLASSFORDISABLE
column.description: CSS class for disabled menu-item

table.name: WebMenuItem
table.description: It provides the way/option to render the response of a menu-action into a given target in web-client.

column.name: MENUITEMID
column.description: ID to refer the table MenuItem.

column.name: ACTIONLINK
column.description: Specifies the Action link URL associated with the menu item. It should be configured only if the action link is not a struts action.

column.name: TARGET
column.description: Specifies the target to render the response either in the new window or the same window. Default target is '_self'.

column.name: WINPARAMS
column.description: Specifies the new window parameters that controlls the size, ablility to resize, maximize, etc.

column.name: ACTIONTYPE
column.description: Type of the request method. Default: GET

table.name: Action
table.description: Maps the struts-action configuration with menu-item

column.name: MENUITEMID
column.description: Refers to the menu-item ID defined in {@link MENUITEM}

column.name: FORWARD
column.description: View/URL to which this action is forwarded. Refer com.apache.struts.action.ActionForward

column.name: TYPE
column.description: Fully Qualified name of the action class, which must be a child of com.apache.struts.action.Action

column.name: NAME
column.description: Name of the action

column.name: INPUT
column.description: Relative path of the input form to which control is returned, if a validation error occurs.

column.name: VALIDATED
column.description: If value is 'true', Action will be validated.

table.name: ACJSOption
table.description: Various custom options, available as attributes of menu-items, needed for the Javascript APIs

column.name: MENUITEMID
column.description: Refers to the menuitem ID defined in {@link MENUITEM}

column.name: NAME
column.description: Name of the option.

column.name: VALUE
column.description: Value for the given option

table.name: ACAjaxOptions
table.description: Various options applicable for actiontypes AJAXGET and AJAXPOST

column.name: MENUITEMID
column.description: Refers to the menuitem ID defined in {@link MENUITEM}

column.name: ONSUCCESSFUNC
column.description: Name of the function to be invoked on response, if the AJAX request succeeds. Default: AjaxAPI.refreshView

column.name: STATUSFUNC
column.description: Name of the function to be invoked for showing response status. Default: AjaxAPI.showRespMsg

table.name: Forward
table.description: A representation of struts forward element configured for an Action Mapping

column.name: MENUITEMID
column.description: Refers to the menuitem ID defined in {@link MENUITEM}

column.name: NAME
column.description: Name of the forward

column.name: PATH
column.description: URL Path for the forward element

column.name: REDIRECT
column.description: If true, control of the action is redirected. Otherwise, forwarded.

table.name: JavaScriptAction
table.description: Javascript functions details, which can be invoked for a given menu item. A Javascript file can be included by its name.

column.name: MENUITEMID
column.description: Refers to the menuitem ID defined in {@link MENUITEM}

column.name: JSFILENAME
column.description: Path/Name of the JavaScript file to be included.

column.name: JSMETHODNAME
column.description: Name of the method/function to be invoked for the given menuitem. In order to pass custom options to this javascript, Use {@link ACJSOPTION}

table.name: ACParams
table.description: It contains details of parameters like name, index, value and scope for a given menu-item.

column.name: MENUITEMID
column.description: ID to refer the 'MENUITEMID_NO' of the table 'MenuItem'

column.name: NAME
column.description: The name of the parameter passed

column.name: PARAMINDEX
column.description: Order of the parameter, applicable only if the parameter has multiple values

column.name: VALUE
column.description: Value of the parameter specified if SCOPE is 'STATIC', otherwise values taken as per defined 'SCOPE'.

column.name: SCOPE

table.name: MenuAndMenuItem
table.description: A mapping between Menu and MenuItem configurations

column.name: MENUID
column.description: Refers to the MENUID_NO in {@link MENU} table

column.name: MENUITEMID
column.description: Refers to the MENUITEMID_NO in {@link MENUITEM} table

column.name: MENUITEMINDEX
column.description: Order of the menu-item in the menu

table.name: UIComponent
table.description: Captures the properties of an UIComponent.

column.name: NAME_NO
column.description: Unique ID to identify the UIComponent

column.name: NAME
column.description: Name of the UIComponent

column.name: DESCRIPTION
column.description: Description of the UIComponent

column.name: STATE
column.description: Fully qualified name of a class that represents the view state retrieved from the request (or) Constructed for API Model. This API must be the child of {@link com.adventnet.client.view.State}

table.name: CSRMenuItem
table.description: Contains action name and argument of action for CSR Components

column.name: MENUITEMID
column.description: Refers to the 'MENUITEMID' in {@link MENUITEM} table

column.name: ACTIONNAME
column.description: Name of the JS function to be invoked

column.name: ACTIONARG
column.description: Argument for the action

table.name: WebUIComponent
table.description: Captures the Web client specific properties of an UIComponent.

column.name: NAME
column.description: Refers to the 'NAME' in the {@link UICOMPONENT} table

column.name: URL
column.description: TRelative path for rendering the views associated with the UIComponent

column.name: VIEWCONTROLLER
column.description: Fully qualified name of a class that creates/updates the view model and passes to the client. This API must be the child of {@link com.adventnet.client.view.web.ViewController}

column.name: TEMPLATENAME
column.description: Template name used for rendering the UIComponent. A view-specific template can be given to override this using {@link VIEWCONFIGURATION#TEMPLATENAME}

column.name: ISCSRCOMPONENT
column.description: Boolean to state, whether the component is Client Side Rendering Type Component or not. Default : false

table.name: PdfUIComponent
table.description: Captures the PDF Client specific properties of an UIComponent

column.name: NAME
column.description: Refers to the 'NAME' in the {@link UICOMPONENT} table

column.name: VIEWCLASS
column.description: Fully qualified name of a class that exports the view model obtained from the view controller. This API must be the child of {@link com.adventnet.client.view.pdf.PDFView}

column.name: VIEWCONTROLLER
column.description: Fully qualified name of a class that creates/updates the view model and passes to the client. This API must be the child of {@link com.adventnet.client.view.web.ViewController}. If null, Web View controller is considered.

table.name: ViewConfiguration
table.description: Contains the configurations for creating different types of views to display the client application data.

column.name: VIEWNAME_NO
column.description: Auto-generated unique ID

column.name: VIEWNAME
column.description: Unique Name to identify this View Configuration.

column.name: COMPONENTNAME
column.description: Refers to the 'NAME' of the component, in {@link UICOMPONENT} table. For example ACTable, CSRTable or ACSQLTable. The list of components can be found in UIComponent Table

column.name: ICONFILE
column.description: Relative URL path of the Icon that is shown along with the title

column.name: IMAGEFILE
column.description: Relative URL path of the Image that is shown along with the title(used for Tab-view)

column.name: TITLE
column.description: Name that is displayed for the particular view when it is rendered.

column.name: DESCRIPTION
column.description: Description for the view configuration.

column.name: ROLENAME
column.description: Role associated with the view. Based on the role, access to the view is restricted.

column.name: MENUID
column.description: Refers to the 'MENUID' in {@link MENU} table which is to be associated with the view.

column.name: CUSTOMIZETYPE
column.description: If PERSONALIZE, a copy of the view(<VIEWNAME>_PERSVIEW_<ACCOUNT_ID>) is created and associated with the User, who tries to customize the view using features like sorting, changing the pagelength and column operations(re-sizing, re-ordering, visibility and display name). Default: NO

column.name: CSSCLASS
column.description: CSS class to be applied for the view while rendering.

column.name: ACCOUNT_ID
column.description: Refers to the User ID

column.name: CHILDBOX
column.description: Image File that is shown along with the tab

column.name: HANDLER
column.description: Fully qualified name of a class can be given to provide additional restriction(apart from role level authorization) to access the view.

column.name: TEMPLATENAME
column.description: Ember template name for the view

column.name: STATE
column.description: Fully qualified name of a class that represents the view state retrieved from the request (or) Constructed for API Model. This API must be the child of {@link com.adventnet.client.view.State}

column.name: PROPERTIES
column.description: Additional Data(JSON format) to be appended in JSON response of view Sample input : {"KEY":"VALUE"}

table.name: AdditionalViewParams
table.description: Represents the request query parameters for the view.

column.name: VIEWNAME
column.description: Refers to the 'VIEWNAME' in {@link VIEWCONFIGURATION} table to which this parameter belongs to

column.name: PARAMNAME
column.description: Name of the parameter to be passed

column.name: PARAMINDEX
column.description: Order of the parameter. To be given only if a parameter has more than one value. Default: 0

column.name: PARAMVALUE
column.description: Value associated with the parameter

table.name: TemplateViewParams
table.description: For a view, the request parameters which are required to be present/carry forwarded to the adjacent requests must be provided here

column.name: VIEWNAME
column.description: Refers to the view name defined in {@link VIEWCONFIGURATION} to which this parameter belongs to

column.name: PARAMNAME
column.description: Name of the parameter

column.name: MANDATORY
column.description: If true, this parameter must be present in the view request.

table.name: FeatureParams
table.description: Includes static parameters which stores information specific to a view. These values can be obtained using {@link com.adventnet.client.view.ViewModel#getFeatureValue}.

column.name: VIEWNAME
column.description: Refers to the 'VIEWNAME' in {@link VIEWCONFIGURATION} table to which this parameter belongs to.

column.name: FEATURENAME
column.description: Name of the parameter

column.name: FEATUREVALUE
column.description: Value assigned to the parameter.

table.name: WebViewConfig
table.description: Holds the Web client specific properties of a View. Overrides the properties provided in {@link WEBUICOMPONENT}

column.name: VIEWNAME
column.description: Refers to the 'VIEWNAME' in {@link VIEWCONFIGURATION} table to which this configuration belongs to

column.name: URL
column.description: Relative path for rendering the view. It overrides the path given in {@link WEBUICOMPONENT#URL}

column.name: VIEWCONTROLLER
column.description: Fully qualified name of the class that creates/updates the view model and passes to the client. This API must be the child of {@link com.adventnet.client.view.web.ViewController}. It overrides the controller given in {@link WEBUICOMPONENT#VIEWCONTROLLER}

table.name: PdfViewConfig
table.description: Holds the PDF client specific properties of a View. Overrides the properties provided in {@link PDFUICOMPONENT}

column.name: VIEWNAME
column.description: Refers to the 'VIEWNAME' in {@link VIEWCONFIGURATION} table to which this configuration belongs to

column.name: VIEWCLASS
column.description: Fully qualified name of the class that exports the view model obtained from the view controller. This API must be the child of {@link com.adventnet.client.view.pdf.PDFView}. It overrides the view class provided in {@link PDFUICOMPONENT#VIEWCLASS}.

column.name: VIEWCONTROLLER
column.description: Fully qualified name of the class that creates/updates the view model and passes to the client. This API must be the child of {@link com.adventnet.client.view.web.ViewController}. It overrides the controller given in {@link PDFUICOMPONENT#VIEWCONTROLLER}. If null, the PDF View controller is considered.

table.name: UINavigationConfig
table.description: Stores rendering related properties of a view

column.name: VIEWNAME
column.description: Refers to the view name defined in {@link VIEWCONFIGURATION}

column.name: CONTENTAREANAME
column.description: Name of the content area where the view is rendered

column.name: ADDTOLIST
column.description: If true, the given view is added with existing views in the content-area or else, Views in the content-area are replaced by the given view. Default: false

column.name: DEFAULTSELECTEDVIEW
column.description: The default view to be rendered among the child views of the given VIEWNAME(parent-view)

column.name: CLEARDEFAULTCONTENTAREA
column.description: Specifies whether to clear the default content area or not. Default: false

column.name: REFRESHLEVEL
column.description: If refresh level is -1, it just opens url, If refresh level is 0, it sends as subrequest(AJAX request) and If refresh level is -2, it sends as subrequest

column.name: TABLEALIAS
column.description: The table alias whose data is passed, if the view is based on data table

table.name: Theme
table.description: Represents the theme icon, theme directory and PDF theme class in a single entity called Theme, identified by theme name. So user can customize the graphical appearance by changing the theme name.

column.name: THEMENAME_NO
column.description: Auto-generated Unique number for the theme

column.name: THEMENAME
column.description: Unique name to identify the theme.

column.name: ICON
column.description: Relative URL path of the icon image for the theme.

column.name: THEME_DIR
column.description: Relative path of the theme's directory.

column.name: PDFTHEME_CLASS
column.description: Fully qualified name of the theme handler class for PDF generator. It must be a child of {@link com.adventnet.client.view.pdf.PDFTheme}. Default: com.adventnet.client.view.pdf.DefaultPDFTheme

table.name: DefaultTheme
table.description: This Theme is the default for the entire application. To make it User specific, configure in {@link ACUSERCLIENTSTATE}.

column.name: THEMENAME
column.description: Refers to the 'THEMENAME_NO' in {@link THEME} table

table.name: ThemeAttributesMapping
table.description: Contains theme-specific attributes and values.

column.name: THEMENAME
column.description: Refers to the 'THEMENAME_NO' in {@link THEME} table

column.name: ATTRIBUTENAME
column.description: Name of the attribute for the theme

column.name: ATTRIBUTEVALUE
column.description: Value of the corresponding attribute

table.name: PersonalizedViewMap
table.description: Maps the View name with its personalized View Name based on the user Account ID.

column.name: ORIGVIEWNAME
column.description: Refers to the 'VIEWNAME_NO' of the view in {@link VIEWCONFIGURATION} table which has been personalized.

column.name: ACCOUNT_ID
column.description: Account ID of the User who personalized the view.

column.name: PERSVIEWNAME
column.description: Refers to the name of the personalized view.

table.name: OpenViewInContentArea
table.description: Used to render a view in a placeholder(content area)

column.name: MENUITEMID
column.description: Refers to the MENUITEMID_NO in {@link MENUITEM}, which is invoked to render the associated view

column.name: VIEWNAME
column.description: Refers to the 'VIEWNAME_NO' of the view in {@link VIEWCONFIGURATION} to be rendered in the given content area

column.name: PARENTVIEWNAME
column.description: Name of the view whose content area is considered, if CONTENTAREANAME is null

column.name: CONTENTAREANAME
column.description: Name of the Content area in which the view is rendered

column.name: ADDTOLIST
column.description: If true, the given view will be added to the content area, though it already has some views. Otherwise, content area will be cleared and the given view is rendered alone.

column.name: REQUESTPARAMS
column.description: Request parameters given here are passed, while rendering the view

column.name: RETRIEVEPARAMSFROMREQ
column.description: If true, templateviewparams {@link TEMPLATEVIEWPARAMS} of the view will be considered in forming the URL query string along with REQUESTPARAMS(if given). Default: true

column.name: DACINDEX
column.description: If more than one content area is given, the last one will be considered

table.name: TiledView
table.description: Allows to display a view in tiled area.

column.name: VIEWNAME
column.description: Refers to the 'VIEWNAME_NO' in {@link VIEWCONFIGURATION} table, which contains the tiled area

column.name: TILENAME
column.description: Name of the area, in which the tiled views has to be rendered

column.name: TILEDVIEWNAME
column.description: Name of the child view that has to be rendered in the tile

table.name: ViewDataTableMapping
table.description: Provides the table names which are associated with a specific view.

column.name: VIEWNAME
column.description: Refers to the 'VIEWNAME' in {@link VIEWCONFIGURATION} table

column.name: TABLENAME
column.description: Name of the table to be associated with the given view

table.name: ACUserClientState
table.description: User specific theme can be configured here.

column.name: ACCOUNT_ID
column.description: Account ID of the User.

column.name: SELECTEDTHEME
column.description: Refers to the 'THEMENAME_NO' in {@link THEME} table

column.name: MODTIME
column.description: The modified time. This field is updated for large scale modifications of UI.

table.name: ACUserPreference
table.description: Stores the user specific configurations as key-value

column.name: ACCOUNT_ID
column.description: ID of the associated user

column.name: PREFNAME
column.description: Name of the customized property/configuration

column.name: VALUE
column.description: Value of the customized property/configuration

column.name: VIEWNAME
column.description: Refers to the view name defined in {@link VIEWCONFIGURATION} to which this configuration belongs to

table.name: ACClientProps
table.description: Stores plain-text parameters as key-value. All generic/miscellaneous configurations are stored.

column.name: ACPROPID
column.description: Auto-generated Unique ID

column.name: PARAMNAME
column.description: Name of the property/configuration

column.name: PARAMVALUE
column.description: Value for the property/configuration

table.name: ACClientEncProps
table.description: Stores encrypted parameters as key-value. All generic/miscellaneous encrypted properties/configurations (e.g. password) are stored.

column.name: ACPROPID
column.description: Auto-generated Unique ID

column.name: PARAMNAME
column.description: Name of the property/configuration

column.name: PARAMVALUE
column.description: Encrypted Value for the given property/configuration

table.name: ACEmailAddress
table.description: Email TO address list

column.name: MAILTOID
column.description: This is a surrogate key. The value is auto generated to identify an TO email address uniquely

column.name: TOADDRESS
column.description: The TO Email Address

column.name: FILE_NO
column.description: Validation File no:

column.name: FILE_NAME
column.description: File name with path

table.name: ViewToOpen
table.description: This table is used to redirect the menu-action to a view.

column.name: MENUITEMID
column.description: Refers to the menu-item ID defined in {@link MENUITEM}

column.name: VIEWNAME
column.description: Refers to the view name defined in {@link VIEWCONFIGURATION}
